That's a great plan! Focusing on developing a strong foundation in research methods, statistical analysis, and academic writing will serve you well in your future academic pursuits. Additionally, taking courses or attending workshops that align with your research interests will help you gain a deeper understanding of the field and make you a more competitive applicant.

Reaching out to academics in your desired field is also an excellent idea. They can provide valuable insights into the application process, offer advice on how to prepare, and share their own experiences. Don't be afraid to ask questions, and be open to feedback and guidance.

Remember to also take care of yourself during this process. Pursuing a doctoral degree can be a challenging and demanding journey, so make sure to prioritize your mental and physical well-being.

Lastly, keep in mind that it's okay to take your time and explore different options. You don't have to rush into a program or make a decision that doesn't feel right. Take your time to research, reflect, and consider your options carefully.

If you have any more questions or need further guidance, feel free to ask. I'm here to help. Good luck with your academic pursuits, and I hope to see you succeed in your future endeavors!
